event.title: was founded in the Beaverhead Valley as a railroad town in 1880

data.event: Dillon was founded in the Beaverhead Valley as a railroad town in 1880 by Union Pacific Railroad President Sydney Dillon.

event.title: discovered in the Dillon area at Grasshopper Creek in 1862

data.event: Gold was first discovered in the Dillon area at Grasshopper Creek in 1862.

event.title: happened in the Argenta area in 1920

data.event: The last real gold rush in the Dillon area happened in the Argenta area in 1920 and lasted for 30 years.
The last real gold rush in the Dillon area happened in the Argenta area in 1920 and lasted for 30 years.
In 1881 Dillon became part of a contentious battle with Bannack to become the county seat of Beaverhead County.

event.title: was built in the frontier town of Dillon in 1882

data.event: The first brick building was built in the frontier town of Dillon in 1882.
